channel.title: Wierd glitch.. IDK What it is..?
channel.description:
I've checked the obvious error of making sure the items are in the correct array but no matter what item i wear, it always gets worn in the helmet slot?
Any ideas?

item.title: Wierd glitch.. IDK What it is..?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

What did you edit then… Cause if it worked fine, then stopped working, you must have changed something or added something which makes it change. Computers don’t just change things automatically, unless your keylogged. It’s a system that is designed to do what YOU tell it to do.

item.source: Wierd glitch.. IDK What it is..?

item.title: Wierd glitch.. IDK What it is..?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

	public int itemType(int item) {
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.capes.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.capes[i]) {
				return playerCape;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.hats.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.hats[i]) {
				return playerHat;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.boots.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.boots[i]) {
				return playerFeet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.gloves.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.gloves[i]) {
				return playerHands;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.shields.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.shields[i]) {
				return playerShield;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.amulets.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.amulets[i]) {
				return playerAmulet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.arrows.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.arrows[i]) {
				return playerArrows;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.rings.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.rings[i]) {
				return playerRing;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.body.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.body[i]) {
				return playerChest;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item.legs.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item.legs[i]) {
				return playerLegs;
			}
		}

		return playerWeapon;
	}

I haven’t touched that… It worked fine before then for some reason it just stopped working lol ;S

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd glitch.. IDK What it is..?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

Like i said, it’s not that the item isn’t in the public static int hats[], because it’s happening for all the items.

And i don’t use an Item4.

@X-J-K-X

What’s your method called? I’ll search for it but it will take me a while to find it myself lol.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 06, 2007, 10:26:20 AM[/size][hr]I found this;

			case 41:	// wear item
				int wearID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
				int wearSlot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
				interfaceID = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
				if (wearID == 5525) {
								showInterface(16248);
				}
				int[] adminItems = {773};
					for(int I = 0; I < adminItems.length; I++)
						if(wearID == adminItems[I] && playerRights < 3)
							checkAdminItem();
						else
			wear(wearID, wearSlot);
				flushOutStream();
				break;
